sections.title: HSE Record for Last Calender Year (using IOGP definitions below)

fields.label: Text Block
fields.text:
Safety definitions source - IOGP “Safety data reporting user guide - Scope and definitions (2017 data)”


SAFETY DEFINITIONS


Hours Worked:

For all Contractor personnel, including staff, management, agency personnel and all independent contractors, subcontractors and other personnel working under Contractor’s direction or on the Contractor’s premises, the actual ‘hours worked’ in the year, including overtime hours, in the case of onshore operations. For offshore workers, the ‘hours worked’ are calculated on a 12-hour work day.

Hours to include all work performed by all Contractor personnel types listed above working under any Client’s HSE-Management System (IOGP Mode 1) and Contractor personnel working under the Contractor’s HSE- Management System where there is a bridging document to any Client’s HSE-Management System or reporting requirement (IOGP Mode 2).


Fatalities:

Cases that involve one or more people who died as a result of a work-related incident.


Lost Work Day Case

Non-fatal cases that involve a person being unfit to perform any work on any day after the occurrence of the occupational injury. ‘Any day’ includes rest days, weekend days, leave days, public holidays or days after ceasing employment


Recordable Incidents:

An unplanned or uncontrolled Event or chain of Events that has resulted in at least one injury that required Medical Treatment (MTC) or more, or physical or environmental damage.


Environmental Spills:

Any loss of containment of any Hazardous Substances including all Hydrocarbons, in liquid, gaseous or solid form, into the environment.
